byline.contributor: Zia ur-Rehman reported from Karachi, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan.
byline.original: By ZIA ur-REHMAN and SALMAN MASOOD

abstract: Karachi, Pakistan, Mayor Waseem Akhtar wins reelection despite having been imprisoned since July on charges including incitement of citywide riots in May 2007; Akhtar's party Muttahida Qaumi Movement, or MQM, has for decades led violent city through combination of wiles and intimidation, but in 2013 it became subject of military crackdown.

headline.print_headline: Pakistani Inmate Faces Charges and New Duties as Mayor of Chaotic Karachi
headline.main: New Karachi Mayor Gets Daytrip From Prison to Be Sworn In

snippet: The election of Waseem Akhtar to lead the city of 22 million comes as his Muttahida Qaumi Movement and its exiled leader are under fire from Pakistan’s military....
lead_paragraph: The election of Waseem Akhtar to lead the city of 22 million comes as his Muttahida Qaumi Movement and its exiled leader are under fire from Pakistan’s military.
